title: Naive Bayes Classification in Machine Learning
description: In Machine Learning Naive Bayes models are a group of high-speed and simple classification algorithms that are often suitable for very high-dimensional datasets. Because they are so fast and have so few tunable parameters, they end up being very useful as a quick-and-dirty baseline for a classification problem. This article will focus on an intuitive explanation of how naive Bayes classification work, followed by a couple of examples of them in action on some datasets.
